org.forgerock.openam.sm.datalayer.impl.tasks

Class ContinuousQueryTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.sm.datalayer.impl.tasks.ContinuousQueryTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Task

    public class ContinuousQueryTask
extends Object
implements Task
    A task representing a continuous query that - once execution has begun on the data layer - will persist and continually pass results back to the supplied listener. Results which match the supplied filter will be pushed up the Connection to the ContinuousQueryListener.
    See Also:
    ContinuousQueryListener, TokenFilter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ContinuousQueryTask(TokenFilter tokenFilter, ContinuousQueryListener listener)
      Generate a new ContinuousQueryTask to be applied to the underlying datastore using the configured TokenFilter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContinuousQueryTask

        public ContinuousQueryTask(TokenFilter tokenFilter,
                           ContinuousQueryListener listener)
        Generate a new ContinuousQueryTask to be applied to the underlying datastore using the configured TokenFilter.
        Parameters:
        tokenFilter - The filter to be continually applied in the datastore layer.
        listener - Results matching the TokenFilter will be sent to this listener.

    • Method Detail

      • getQuery

        public org.forgerock.util.promise.Promise<ContinuousQuery,org.forgerock.util.promise.NeverThrowsException> getQuery()
        Retrieve the query promise which this task generated. This will only contain a valid ContinuousQuery once execute has been called.
        Returns:
        The ContinuousQuery generated by this task, via an originally generated Promise.

      • processError

        public void processError(DataLayerException error)
        Description copied from interface: Task
        Set the task error. Used for setting the error response without executing the task. If the task can't be executed, this method is called.
        Specified by:
        processError in interface Task
        Parameters:
        error - the problem that happened before processing the task.
